comment._content: Youssouf Zia Pacha was Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to the United States of America from June 14, 1910 to 1914 [ ref. www.state.gov/s/cpr/94538.htm ]

comment.author: 38026030@N00
comment._content: wondering if this is during St. Louis, MO world fair in 1914

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
NOT St. Louis, and NOT 1914: This is the Pan American Union building in Washington, 
D. C., on January 1, 1913.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Second only in importance to the White House Reception was the breakfast at the Pan-American Union Building where the Secretary of State and Mrs. Knox entertained the members of the Diplomatic Corps and their families, withthe members of the Committees of the House and Senate dealing with our foreign relations. To welcome these guests the Secretary and Mrs. Knox dropped out of the White House receving line after the passing of the Supreme Court. In the Pan-American Building they received standing at the head of the marble stairway overlooking the patio. The breakfast was served in the Hall of the Americas, regarded as the most beautiful formal apartment in Washington." see citations by flickr member BobMeade, under the Hall of the Americas, where the breakfast was held:
